Specialisations in hotels, integrated resorts and MICE sectors.
Bachelor of Business in Hospitality and Tourism Management (HTM) with Honours
Prior to Academic Year 2025, this programme was formerly known as the

The Bachelor of Business in Hospitality and Tourism Management (HTM) with Honours is a direct honours degree programme and the first and only hospitality and tourism management degree offered by an autonomous university in Singapore.

The programme aims to nurture hospitality, events, and tourism professionals who are passionate about making positive contributions to the industry. By addressing industry needs, graduates will be competitive and forward-thinking. Those completing the Hospitality and Tourism Management programme can expect to develop strong managerial skills (know-how) grounded in solid theoretical knowledge (know-why). Additionally, they will cultivate cultural sensitivity and critical thinking skills that align with the international nature of Singapore’s hospitality and tourism landscape.

Our curriculum combines theory with current industry practices and offers specialisations in Hotel & Integrated Resort Management, Event & Entertainment, and Travel & Tourism. It also provides a solid general business foundation and includes an Integrated Work Study Programme (IWSP) or Overseas IWSP (OIWSP) as an applied learning platform.

Graduates of Hospitality and Tourism Management will be well-prepared for managerial positions in a variety of hospitality, events, and tourism organisations, both in Singapore and internationally. Examples of potential roles include hospitality sales professionals, hotel revenue analysts, event experience designers, tourism and hospitality consultants, destination marketing specialists, tourism bureau officers, food and beverage entrepreneurs, guest experience specialists at cruise lines, visitor engagement professionals at tourist attractions, tourism e-commerce analysts, airport operations professionals, and airline passenger services representatives. Additionally, some of our graduates move into other business-related fields, such as banking and government agencies, leveraging their transferable service knowledge and business management skills.

Integrated Work Study Programme provides students with the opportunity to undertake real work. Held over the span of eight months, it is designed to be more in-depth than a traditional internship. You will gain real work experience and apply the theories you learn in class with actual practice.
Graduates can look forward to working in, but not limited to, the following occupational fields:
Guest Experience Specialists at Cruise Lines
Visitor Engagement Professionals at Tourist Attractions
Technology and Digitalisation for Hospitality and Lifestyle Business
Elective modules in one of the three tracks.
Electives Option 1 – Hotel and Integrated Resort Specialisation
Electives Option 2 – Events and Entertainment Specialisation
Electives Option 3 – Travel and Tourism Specialisation
The list of available modules for Unrestricted Electives will be announced once finalised.

The programme structure is subject to change without prior notice. SIT regularly reviews its curriculum to ensure that it remains industry-relevant and prepares our students for the evolving needs of industry.
A minor is available for this programme. For more details, please click
Diploma holders from any of the five local polytechnics, A-level / IB Diploma graduates, and holders of equivalent Year 12 qualifications are welcome to apply.
The members of the Industry Advisory Committee for this programme are:
FEO Hospitality Asset Management Pte Ltd
Managing Director and Vice President (International Markets)
Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director, Sands China Ltd
Executive Vice President of Asia Operations, Las Vegas Sands Corp
